review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: Please add a space between `xs` and `=>` and I think you can conclude with `case: q` without mentioning `x`. (not tested)

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: In this file, predicates are usually named `a`, `p` or `q`, could you rename `g` to one of these?

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: please add a space between `s` and `=>`

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment:
I am a bit confused by this proof script, I would find it more readable if there were less cases/splits in one go, and no introduction in the `last`.
e.g.
```coq
apply/(iffP andP)=> [[/allP ...]|His].
....
split; first by ....
....
```
or something like that.

review_discussion.author: pi8027
review_discussion.comment: `case: q` produces `Error: q is used in conclusion.`

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: I guess `case: {+}q` would work then, but you can keep the original form then...

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: please prefix this line with a `by`

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: Could you please use more meaningful names instead of `H...` (e.g. `x_in_s` or `x_s`, etc) ?

commits.author: pi8027
commits.message: Add all_filter, all_pmap, and all_allpairsP in seq.v
